profiles.name: French System Major Fifth - Strong two

conventions.name: Opening system chosen for the following 1-level opening bids
conventions.desc: It is the 4 following opening bids: 1#C/1#D/1#H/1#S

values.name: Best minor
values.desc:
For a minor opening bid, you will open with your longest minor. With equal-length minors, you will always open with  1#D, except with a 3/3 minor suit which you will open with  1#C. 
For a major opening bid, you will need at least a 5-card suit.

values.name: 4-card #D
values.desc:
For a minor opening bid, you will open with your longest minor(except with 3#D and 2#C, which you will open with 1#C), with equal length suits, you will always open with 1#D except with a 3/3 minor suit, which you will open with 1#C. 
For a major opening bid, you will need at least a 5-card suit.

values.name: ACOL
values.desc: You open your longest suit in minor and in major

values.name: Polish #C
values.desc:
The 1#C opening bid is artificial: with either a strong 18+ hand, or with a 12-14 HCP balanced hand. 
All the other one-level opening bids show at least a 5-card suit.

conventions.name: Minimum number of points for a 1-level opening bid
conventions.desc: With less than 12 HCP, North will open with at least 14HD

conventions.name: Possibility for a 1#N opening with a 5-card major
conventions.desc: Of course: with also a balanced hand and the required point range.

values.name: Semi forcing
values.desc: 18-23 HCP with a good long suit or balanced 22-23HCP

values.name: Acol
values.desc: Game forcing: with 24+ or a strong enough hand to bid to game level on your own power

values.name: Strong two
values.desc: 18-23 HCP and 6 good cards in #C

values.name: Polish strong two
values.desc: 11-15 HCP with 5#C and a 4-card major or with at least 6#C

values.name: Acol
values.desc: 24+ or a strong enough hand to bid to game level on your own power (minimum 16 HCP)

values.name: Natural weak two
values.desc: 5-10 HCP with 6 good cards in #D

values.name: Natural strong two
values.desc: 18-23 HCP with 6 good cards in #D

values.name: Multi 2D
values.desc: 5-10 HCP with 6 cards in #H or 6 cards in #S

values.name: Wilkosz
values.desc: 5-10 HCP in a 2 suiter hand with at least one major suit

values.name: Natural weak
values.desc: 5-10 HCP with 6 good cards in #H

values.name: Muiderberg 5/5
values.desc: 5-10 HCP in a two-suiter hand with 5#H and a 5-card major

values.name: Natural strong
values.desc: 18-23 HCP with 6 good cards in #H

values.name: Muiderberg 5/4
values.desc: 5-10 HCP in a two-suiter hand with 5#H and an at least 4-card minor

values.name: Two-suiter with #H and another suit
values.desc: 5-10 HCP in a two-suiter hand with 5#H and another unknown at least 4-card suit

values.name: Natural weak
values.desc: 5-10 HCP with 6 good cards in #S

values.name: Muiderberg 5/5
values.desc: 5-10 HCP in two-suiter hand with 5#S and a 5-card minor suit

values.name: Natural strong
values.desc: 18-23 HCP and 6 good cards in #S

values.name: Muiderberg 5/4
values.desc: 5-10 HCP and a two-suiter hand with 5#S and an at least 4-card minor

values.name: Minor two-suiter
values.desc: 5-10 HCP and a two-suiter hand with at least 5#C and 5#D

conventions.name: Suit quality required for a preempt bid

values.name: Classical
values.desc: 5-10 HCP and a good suit: 2 high honours or 3 honours

values.name: Agressive
values.desc: 4-9 HCP and at least one high honour or 2 honours

values.name: Terrorist
values.desc: 2-8 HCP and no suit quality criterion

values.name: Gambling
values.desc: An at least 7-card solid minor without any external Ace or King

conventions.name: Namyats
conventions.desc:
The 4#C opening bid shows a 4#H opening bid with at most one looser in trumps and the 4#D shows a 4#S opening bid with at most one looser in trumps. 
The direct 4#H and 4#S opening bids show hands with a less good suit

groups.title: Meaning of responses to an opening bid

conventions.name: 2#H over 1#C/#D
conventions.desc: On a minor suit opening bid, jumping to 2#H shows at least  5#S and 4#H in a 5-9 HCP hand

conventions.name: Forcing 1#N response
conventions.desc:
The forcing 1#N response convention on a major opening bid forces Opener to rebid on the response.   
He cannot pass 1#N and with a balanced 5332 hand, he will bid his best minor.

conventions.name: 1#N with fit and a weak hand
conventions.desc: On a major opening bid, the 1#N response can show a fit with a hand too weak for a direct raise at 2-level (3-5 HCP)

conventions.name: Game forcing 2/1
conventions.desc: On a major opening bid, suit changes at 2-level without jump are game forcing. 2/1 suit changes show 12+ HCP otherwise you bid 1#N.

conventions.name: 2#N over 1#H/#S
conventions.desc: Meaning of the 2#N bid in response to a major opening bid.

values.name: Jacoby
values.desc: An at least 3-card fit in a game forcing hand. Partner will bid his shortness. By inference, a direct jump raise on a major opening bid  shows 3 or 4 trumps

conventions.name: Jump suit responses
conventions.desc: Meaning of jump shift suit responses to a major opening bid.

values.name: Strong
values.desc: 16 HCP and a good 6-card suit

values.name: Invitational
values.desc: Encouraging without fit, with 9-11 HCP and a 6-card suit

values.name: Natural with fit
values.desc: 5 cards in the bid suit with a 4-card fit and an invitational hand

values.name: Bergen
values.desc: The 3#C jump shows 10-11 HCP and 4 trumps, the 3#D jump shows 7-9 HCP and 4 trumps, a jump fit at 3-level shows 4-6 HCP and 4 trumps

conventions.name: 3#N on 1#H/#S
conventions.desc: After a major opening bid, meaning of the 3#N response

values.name: 11-14 HCP with fit and 3 or 4 trumps

conventions.name: Responses to a 1#N opening bid
conventions.desc: Meaning of the responses to a 1#N opening bid

values.name: Stayman 3 responses with transfers
values.desc: With 4#H and 4#S, you will respond 2#H on the Stayman

conventions.name: Responses on a game forcing 2#C or 2#D

values.name: Ace responses
values.desc:
You will respond the Ace suit.
With just one ambiguity: after 2#D, the 2#S bid shows a major Ace.

values.name: Natural
values.desc:
You bid the next suit with 0-7 HCP.
All other bids are natural with 8+ HCP

conventions.name: Responses to a 2#N opening bid
conventions.desc: Meaning of the responses to a 2#N opening bid.

values.name: Stayman with major and minor transfers
Puppet Stayman with major and minor transfers
values.desc: Puppet Stayman (3#C) allows you to look for both a 4-card or 5-card major in the 2#N Opener's hand

groups.title: Conventions in case of an uncontested auction

conventions.name: Roudi
conventions.desc: Choice of developments after a 1#N rebid by Opener

values.name: 4 answers Roudi
values.desc: 2#C asks Opener for his strength and whether he has 3 cards in the responded suit

values.name: Ping-pong
values.desc: On 2#C Opener has to bid 2#D

values.name: 3 answers
values.desc: 2#C asks Opener for his strength and whether he owns 3 cards in the responded suit but the 2#N rebid doesn't exist

conventions.name: 3rd suit forcing
conventions.desc: If Opener has repeated his opened suit as second bid and if Responder bids a new suit (a 3rd suit), this bid doesn't show anything special in the suit itself but makes the auction forcing.

conventions.name: 4th suit forcing
conventions.desc:
If the first 3 bids were in 3 different suits, bidding the 4th suit is artificial.  
It makes the auction forcing and simply asks Opener to further describe his hand

conventions.name: Blackwood
conventions.desc:
The 4#N bid is used to ask the partner for his number of Aces or key-cards. When you play key-card Blackwood, trump King is considered as an Ace. 
There are therefore 5 key-cards: the 4 Aces and trump King.

values.name: Classical 30/41
values.desc: Responses are: 5#C = 0 or 3 Aces, 5#D = 1 or 4 Aces, 5#H = 2 Aces without trump King, 5#S = 2 Aces + trump King

values.name: Key-cards 30/41
values.desc: Responses are: 5#C = 0 or 3 key-cards, 5#D = 1 or 4 key-cards, 5#H = 2 key-cards without trump Queen, 5#S = 2 key-cards + trump Queen

values.name: Classical 41/30
values.desc: Responses are: 5#C = 1 or 4 Aces, 5#D = 0 or 3 Aces, 5#H = 2 Aces without trump King, 5#S = 2 Aces + trump King

values.name: Key-cards 41/30
values.desc: Responses are: 5#C = 0 or 4 key-cards, 5#D = 1 or 3 key-cards, 5#H = 2 key-cards without trump Queen, 5#S = 2 key-cards + trump Queen

conventions.name: Drury
conventions.desc: On a major opening bid in 3rd or 4th seat, the 2#C response shows a maximum pass hand with a fit and asks Opener for the quality of his opening bid.

conventions.name: Accept transfer with fit only
conventions.desc: Accepting transfer with fit only on major transfers after a 2#N opening bid or 2#N rebid

conventions.name: Checkback Stayman
conventions.desc: A convention that consists in bidding 3#C after Opener has rebid 2#N as second bid to know whether he holds 3 cards in the responded major

conventions.name: Splinter
conventions.desc: A jump shift bid (or double jump) showing a shortness (void or singleton) in the bid suit and a fit in the last suit bid by partner.

conventions.name: 2#D transfer for heart after the 1#S 1#N 2#C auction
conventions.desc:
After the 1#S 1#N 2#C auction,
2#D shows 5 cards in #H and 2 cards in #S or 5 cards in #H and 4 cards in #C
2#H shows 5 cards in #H with a misfit or 6 cards in #H

groups.title: Meaning of the responses after an overcall

conventions.name: "Collante" convention
conventions.desc: After a 1-level opponent's overcall (with 1#D or 1#H), a direct bid of the next suit shows 5 cards and a double shows 4 cards in the next suit.

conventions.name: Truscott
conventions.desc: After a double overcall, a fit at 3-level becomes very weak and 2#N becomes the invitational bid

conventions.name: Defense after a 2-level overcall on a 1#N opening bid

values.name: Rubensohl
values.desc: All bids from 2#N on are transfers

values.name: Lebensohl
values.desc: 2#N shows a competitive hand with an unknown suit, all other bids at 3-level are natural and forcing

conventions.name: Landik
conventions.desc: After a minor suit opening bid followed by a 1#N overcall, 2#C show an at least 5/4 major two-suiter

conventions.name: Playing transfers (Opener's partner) after a 1#N overcall
conventions.desc: After a minor or major opening bid followed by a 1#N overcall, all Opener partner's bids are transfers

conventions.name: Rodrigue
conventions.desc: After a 1#S overcall, bidding Opener's minor at 2-level shows 5 cards in #H with 5-9 HCP

conventions.name: Defense against 2#N showing a minor two-suiter
conventions.desc: After a major opening bid and a 2#N overcall, Responder bids 3#C to show a good hand with #H, 3#D to show a good hand with #S, the 3#H and 3#S direct bids are competitive

groups.title: Meaning of overcalls and of responses to overcalls

conventions.name: Two-suiter
conventions.desc: Overcalls showing a two-suiter

values.name: Michaël's cue-bid French standard implementation
values.desc: 2#N always shows the two lowest ranking suits. On a minor opening bid, 2#D shows 2 major suits and on a major opening bid the Cuebid shows the other major and #C. To show the other major and #D you have to jump to 3#C

values.name: Michaël's cue-bid
values.desc: 2#N always shows the two lowest ranking suits. On a minor opening bid, 2#D shows 2 major suits and on a major opening bid the Cuebid shows the other major and an unknown minor

conventions.name: Two-suiter at 4-level against weak twos
conventions.desc: 4#C shows the other major and #D and 4#D shows the other major and #C

conventions.name: The X overcall on 1#N
conventions.desc: Meaning of the X overcall on 1#N

values.name: Penalty
values.desc: You think opponents are going to go down

values.name: Take-out for majors
values.desc: A hand with which you would have bid a take-out double on a 1#C or 1#D opening bid

values.name: Minor/Major
values.desc: An opening hand value with a 5-card minor and a 4-card major

values.name: Landy
values.desc: An at least 5/4 major two-suiter

conventions.name: 2#C overcall on 1#N
conventions.desc: Meaning of the 2#C overcall on a 1#N opening bid

values.name: Landy
values.desc: An at least 5/4 major two-suiter

conventions.name: 2#D overcall on 1#N
conventions.desc: Meaning of the 2#D overcall on a 1#N opening bid

values.name: Multi
values.desc: 2#D shows an unknown 6-card major suit. By inference, the 2#H and 2#S overcalls show 5 cards with another 4-card minor. Please note that this convention is not played in the balancing seat

conventions.name: 1#N in balancing position
conventions.desc: Use the 1#N bid after Pass to show an reverse 6/4 two-suiter: 6 cards in the lowest ranking suit and 4 cards in the highest ranking suit

conventions.name: 2#N Lebensohl convention after a weak-two opening bid is doubled
conventions.desc: 2#N then shows a hand with 8-10 HCP while a directly bid suit shows less than 8 HCP

conventions.name: Jump shift with fit in response to an overcall

values.name: 4th best
values.desc: You lead the 4th best of your longest suit

values.name: 3rd/5th
values.desc: You try to show if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore lead a low card with an odd number and a high card then a lower one with an even number

values.name: Encouraging low card
values.desc: You will lead a low card with an honour and a high card without an honour

values.name: 4th best
values.desc: You lead the 4th best of your longest suit

values.name: 3rd/5th
values.desc: You try to show if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore lead a low card with an odd number and a high card then a lower one with an even number

values.name: Encouraging low card
values.desc: You will lead a low card with an honour and a high card without an honour

values.name: Italian
values.desc: You will discard an odd card in a suit you are interested in and an even card in a suit you are not interested in

values.name: 3rd/5th
values.desc: You try to discard showing if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore discard a low card with an odd number and a high card then a lower one with an even number

values.name: Direct
values.desc: You will discard a high card in a suit you are interested in and a low card in a suit you are not interested in

values.name: Italian
values.desc: You will discard an odd card in a suit you are interested in and an even card in a suit you are not interested in

values.name: 3rd/5th
values.desc: You try to discard showing if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore lead a low card with an odd number and a high card then a lower one with an even number

values.name: Direct
values.desc: You will discard a high card in a suit you are interested in and a low card in a suit you are not interested in

conventions.name: Defense
conventions.desc: Meaning of card played to follow suit in defense

values.name: 3rd/5th
values.desc: You try to show if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore follow suit with a low card with an odd number and a high card then a lower one with an even number

values.name: 2nd/4th
values.desc: You try to show if you have an even or odd number of cards in the lead suit. You will therefore follow suit with a low card with an even number and a high card then a lower one with an odd number

conventions.name: Suit preference
conventions.desc: You try to show suit preference: when you play for your partner to ruff or when Dummy holds a singleton, a low card asks for a lead in the lowest ranking suit and a high card for a lead in the highest ranking suit
